messages.message: @Gwen how are you seeing this component, are you using feature flags to get this? Or are you not in prod?
its on prod, isn’t it fully live?
I just created a new account to manage deloitte’s instance  and it was exposed there

you have to turn on enable data type and / or enable field description in order to see these; by default these options are off, and these options are also not available for any external users. this feature is not going out until 24.12

Thanks Kerry & Gwen. I’ve seen a few reports of people using this when not expecting, and they have suggested they haven’t changed the feature flag settings.

@Gwen are you sure you didn’t turn that on?
Ah - hm I might have turned it on :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-2:
you can easily check if those flags are turned on in settings
Question: If i make the project and have the flags turned on, and someone from deloitte logs in (to the shared workspace) and opens it, what behaviour are we expecting?
hmm i'm not sure, i think they still won't see the experimental features; if it's a project that you have to share with any of the external users, please don't turn on any experimental flags

+1. @Gwen these should only be turned on if you are explicitly testing that feature.

I only use them for specific demos (where i’ve tested my workflow beforehand) or if i’m running tests on a new feature.

As a general rule these should all be off for day to day use.
@Kerry If i compiled it with the features and they drop files in, would that work for them?
:melting_face: @Lee ill see what i can do
you mean if you generated an app? they will be able to use your app yes, but these features might not be matured enough so use at your own risks...
